Rent a pocket WIFI to have internet access everywhere. It is very convenient when travelling since most of the hotels have limited internet access. It works even in the subway!

Did you forget your toothbrush? Are you jet-lagged and need a coffee fix at 4am? 

You need a konbini, a convenience store that is open 24/7. Here you will find from food and drinks, to first necessity articles. 

Some known konibini chains are: 
- Lawson 
- 7-Eleven 
- FamilyMart 
- Daily

The Suica card is a prepaid smart card that allows you to use most public transport (metro, trains, buses, monorail) in Japan. The card is debited for every trip or purchase you make when you touch the card to the reader. \n\nThe Suica card was created by JR East, but can also be used throughout Japan on the other prepaid card networks like Pasmo.
Annual Freedom Day Hip Hop Festival.
Corner Bree and Henry Nxumalo, Newtown, 111 Ritual store

Dinner in the Sky is a hosted table suspended at a height of up to 60 metres by crane and executed by a team of professionals. It accommodates for 22 people around the table at every session with three staff in the middle.
Val Bonne Country Estate, Modderfontein Nature Reserve, Johannesburg
Lunch: R420.00 Per Person. Afternoon Snack: R295.00 Per Person (60 min. experience)
The Festival provides a platform for readers, writers, artists, school youth, children, adults and the public to read more.
Mary Fitzgerald Square, Newtown. (Venue Changes Every Year)
Maboneng Precinct Kruger street will be closed especially for the screening, bring your blankets, grab a beanbag, complimentary Jameson welcome drinks and popcorn, sit and enjoy the film!

The local community hall or school hall becomes the place where aspirant individuals and group of individuals can meet to begin the workshop and rehearse their ideas and work towards the development of a final production.
cnr Bolani Link and Bolani Rd, Jabulani, Soweto, 1868
STR.CRD is Africa\'s #1 street culture brand that manifests itself through events, workshops, and this channel
Two days of soccer esports for casual or serious gamers, with music and entertainment for friends and family. Reserve your spot to play FIFA 17 and win a share R1.5 million.
Gallagher Convention Centre, 19 Richard Drive, Midrand, Johannesburg, 1685
The Cradle of Humankind is renowned as the place where humankind originated.

Gold Reef City is one of South Africa’s top family attractions. Reminiscent of an authentic turn-of-the-century mining town and conveniently located just 8 kilometers from the centre of Johannesburg. More than 30 roller coasters and thrill rides, an interactive history of gold mining and a 4D theater.
Northern Pkwy and Data Cres, Ormonde 99-Ir, Johannesburg, 2159

The heart and essence of the city of Joburg. With its beginnings in art, Maboneng has evolved into a collaborative hub of culture, business and lifestyle that entices curiosity, encourages exploration and promotes a sense of urban togetherness.
286 Fox St and Kruger St, Jeppestown, Johannesburg, 2094

The Nelson Mandela Bridge is a bridge in Johannesburg, South Africa. It was completed in 2003, and cost R102-120 million to build. Named Nelson Mandela bridge in recognition of the role Nelson Mandela was having in uniting South African society, and the symbolism of linkage and unity provided by the bridge.

First National Bank Stadium or simply FNB Stadium, also known as Soccer City and The Calabash, is a stadium located in Nasrec, bordering the Soweto area of Johannesburg, South Africa. Soccer City hosted the first and last match of the 2010 FIFA World CupTM, including the opening and closing ceremonies.
